page.title: 10 FOOD
page.content: Most children have cereal particularly cornflakes or weetabix for breakfast. During the week quite a few have toast and as many have nothing. On Sunday morning lots of familes have bacon and egg as a treat. Nearly everyone has a packed lunch on school days of meat paste, cheese or jam sandwiches because there are no cooked meals available. Sunday again is special because most people have a joint of lamb, pork, beef or a chicken, with vegetables and gravy. The evening meal for most pupils is a cooked meal with meat or fish. Quite a few have potato chips with sausages, egg, baked beans and bacon all covered in tomato sauce. The most popular drinks are tea, coffee or orange squash. Less milk is drunk than in our parent's day.
